metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3464 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent: Server: DDL). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.54 and earlier, 5.6.35 and earlier and 5.7.17 and earlier. Easily "exploitable" vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.3 (Integrity impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadbclient18 - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-5.5 - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-common - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-5.5 - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test-5.5 - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libmysqlclient18 - 5.5.55-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libmysqld-pic - 5.5.55-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client - 5.5.55-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-5.5 - 5.5.55-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.55-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common - 5.5.55-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server - 5.5.55-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.5 - 5.5.55-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.55-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.5 - 5.5.55-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.5.55-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.5 - 5.5.55-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mysql-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.55-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mysql-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
